alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Mecklenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 7:44PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mecklenburg and southwestern Brunswick Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 744 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Norlina, or 12 miles northwest of Warrenton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gasburg, Ebony, Beechwood, Bowens Corner, John H Kerr Dam, White Plains, Richardson, Bracey, Keats, Eppes Fork, Palmer Springs, John H Kerr Reservoir and Lake Gaston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
